issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I added a print statement to esibase.py to print the env vars and the region...so that is at the top of the output below.  The file /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem exists and is ascii characters so it should be interpreted as a string.

{code:java}
[root@a-21 ~]# esi-install-image --install-default
region is localhost
('EUCA_REPORTING_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Reporting/')
('AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudWatch/')
('EC2_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/compute/')
('TOKEN_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Tokens/')
('AWS_CREDENTIAL_EXPIRATION', None)

('EUCALYPTUS_CERT', '/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem')

('AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID', 'AKIAAO7NQAHNPPIQGTWS')
('AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudFormation/')
('EUCA_BOOTSTRAP_URL', 'http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Empyrean/')
Installing Service Image...
Found tarball /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.38.tar.xz
Decompressing tarball: /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.38.tar.xz
Installing image from eucalyptus-service-image.raw
Bundling, uploading and registering image to bucket: eucalyptus-service-image-1.38
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/esi-install-image", line 220, in <module>

  File "/usr/bin/esi-install-image", line 144, in install

fields.summary: esi-install-image --install-default fails with TypeError: execv() arg 2 must contain only strings

comments.body:
Environment is created with {code}eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`{code}
This is output of env variables
{code}
[root@g-19-02 ~]# euca-generate-environment-config --region localhost --simple
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=AKIAAVNCPZS4DSRIY6QT
AWS_AUTO_SCALING_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/AutoScaling/
AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudFormation/
AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudWatch/
AWS_CREDENTIAL_EXPIRATION=
AWS_ELB_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/LoadBalancing/
AWS_IAM_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Euare
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=C2NdP3PgoGyF8i5SDjlRxchAx4mkE0JaMDgMYB38
AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN=
EC2_CERT=
EC2_PRIVATE_KEY=
EC2_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/compute/
EC2_USER_ID=
EUCALYPTUS_CERT=/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem
EUCA_BOOTSTRAP_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Empyrean/
EUCA_PROPERTIES_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Properties/
EUCA_REPORTING_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Reporting/
S3_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/objectstorage/
TOKEN_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Tokens/
{code}
The EC2_USER_ID is missing and euca-install-image needs it.

If I pass fake EC2_USER_ID the euca-install-image is faling with Connection reset by peer
{code}
euca-install-image -b eucalyptus-service-image-1.38 -i eucalyptus-service-image.raw -r x86_64 -n eucalyptus-service-image-v1.38 --virt hvm --region localhost --user 012345678912 --ec2cert /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem
/var/tmp/bundle-G6lFve/eucalyptus-service-image.raw.part.00 100% |=======================|  10.00 MB 207.58 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
euca-install-image: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))
Process Process-3:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 232, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 88, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/bundle/pipes/fittings.py", line 162, in _write_parts
    partinfo_mpconn.send(partinfo)
IOError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
error writing output file

gzip: stdout: Broken pipe
Process Process-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 232, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 88, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/bundle/pipes/core.py", line 231, in _create_tarball_from_stream
    tarball.close()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 1768, in close
    self.fileobj.write(NUL * (BLOCKSIZE * 2))
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 465, in write
    self.__write(s)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 473, in __write
    self.fileobj.write(self.buf[:self.bufsize])
IOError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
Exception IOError: (32, 'Broken pipe') in <bound method _Stream.__del__ of <tarfile._Stream instance at 0x1565c68>> ignored
{code}
Looks like OSG on a different host in this setup so euca-install-image can't connect S3.

As a bare minimum few urls should be set in the system. This is example of euca2ools.ini config for this set up:
{code}
[region one]
s3-url = http://10.111.5.183:8773/services/objectstorage
properties-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Properties/
ec2-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/compute/
certificate=/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem
{code}
The tool should be invoked via esi-install-image --install-default --region one

Fixed in 3c4ba30e6133287733640a349bb136a2df198df2.
Matt you will need to wait for new build before testing this. You also need to have some env variables defined before invoking esi-install-image.

Fix verified.

After creating a new cloud had to downgrade the service image to be able to install an image but it works as expected:


{code:java}
[root@g-05-05 ~]# euare-accountlist
eucalyptus	000656285184
(eucalyptus)database	000487055740
(eucalyptus)imaging	000434155907
(eucalyptus)blockstorage	000674602208
(eucalyptus)loadbalancing	000916787802
(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read	000851070314
(eucalyptus)cloudformation	000257720528
(eucalyptus)objectstorage	000534671188
[root@g-05-05 ~]# euca-describe-regions 
REGION	eucalyptus	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
[root@g-05-05 ~]# euca-generate-environment-config --region g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com --simple
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=AKIAAMOOEWROE42JEPJ5
AWS_AUTO_SCALING_URL=http://autoscaling.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL=http://cloudformation.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL=http://cloudwatch.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
AWS_CREDENTIAL_EXPIRATION=
AWS_ELB_URL=http://loadbalancing.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
AWS_IAM_URL=http://euare.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=ZAPO4j5gXluA6glTCMjuJp6rBwcU9HK0IFvvkwyX
AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN=
EC2_CERT=/root/euca2-admin-df5e2d53-cert.pem
EC2_PRIVATE_KEY=/root/euca2-admin-df5e2d53-pk.pem
EC2_URL=http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
EC2_USER_ID=000656285184
EUCALYPTUS_CERT=/root/cloud-cert.pem
EUCA_BOOTSTRAP_URL=http://10.111.1.177:8773/services/Empyrean
EUCA_PROPERTIES_URL=http://10.111.1.177:8773/services/Properties
EUCA_REPORTING_URL=
S3_URL=http://objectstorage.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
TOKEN_URL=http://tokens.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
[root@g-05-05 ~]# esi-install-image --install-default
Installing Service Image...
Found tarball /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.40.tar.xz
Decompressing tarball: /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.40.tar.xz
Installing image from eucalyptus-service-image.raw
Bundling, uploading and registering image to bucket: eucalyptus-service-image-1.40
Registered image: emi-7bb41a50
services.imaging.worker.image = emi-7bb41a50
services.loadbalancing.worker.image = emi-7bb41a50
services.database.worker.image = emi-7bb41a50
[root@g-05-05 ~]# esi-describe-images 
    SERVICE     VERSION  ACTIVE     IMAGE      INSTANCES 
    imaging       1.41           emi-d2e0dea8      1     
    imaging       1.40     *     emi-7bb41a50      0     
 loadbalancing    1.41           emi-d2e0dea8      0     
 loadbalancing    1.40     *     emi-7bb41a50      0     
    database      1.41           emi-d2e0dea8      0     
    database      1.40     *     emi-7bb41a50      0     
{code}
